availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Jackson Ross (Mason County, Kentucky, printer)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, printer. Kentucky native. Employed by publisher Thomas B. Stevenson as a printer with J. Carter Williams, Franklin Bayher, and Thomas A. Ross, in Mason County in 1850. Printer in Mason County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p.31A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, East Maysville, District 2, p. 169.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville Ward 4, p. 437A.
Edmund Janes Cleveland and Horace Gillette Cleveland, The Genealogy of the Cleveland And Cleaveland Families: An Attempt to Trace, In Both the Male And Female Lines, the Posterity of Moses Cleveland ... (Hartford, CT: Printed for the subscribers by the Case, Lockwood & Brainard Company, 1899), 1573.
